column1: Smoque BBQ////I'm not sure what all the hype is about.  Actually I do
column2: Midwesterners don't know shiieettt about quality BBQ.  Smoque has good BBQ for Chicago
column3: but compared to good BBQ in the South
column4: it's not up to par.  The sides are small
column5: and the menu is over priced.  My friend and I ordered a full rack of ribs and a side order of brisket.  The baby back ribs were relatively dry and while the brisket was pretty good
column6: you barely get any.  $6 for 4 slices.  The ribs and brisket came out to over $30 dollars
column7: not terrible but left hungry.  Expect to spend $20 to get a full belly.
